text: primary schools in England will begin
readmitting some pupils this week amidst
warnings from teaching unions that it's
too soon
parents of nursery reception year 1 and
year 6 pupils will be able to choose
whether to send their children back to
school during lockdown schools have only
been open to vulnerable children and
those of key workers school governors
have told the BBC that some schools will
only reopen part-time our education

from Manchester we've had to think about
everything from the moment the parents

that we've put down that parents must

and children arriving tomorrow morning

have made videos of how the children

everything is just a little bit
different but we want to ease that
anxiety for parents and children even

ready to take back nursery reception

it's not in this Manchester community

News outdoor markets and car showrooms
will be allowed to reopen in England
tomorrow with safety measures in place
as the restrictions on non-essential
retailers start to be eased all other
shops plasters non-essential are
preparing to open from June the 15th
here's our business correspondent Katie
Austin Neil's getting ready to sell his

are planning a new safe stall layout but
that we've just got to get into the
system of working again however slow

it's very important plus me what about

one Traders Association says those

other non-essential shops in England

I've closed one changing rooms have got
